result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan J Hoyt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bryan J Hoyt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bryan J Hoyt was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation on 16CF1128.

Costs to be paid as a condition of probation on 16CF1128.
  Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for the New Berlin Police Department. 
Transcript Fee to be forwarded to the District Attorney.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Sentence credit of 30 days was granted.  TIME SERVED.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Perform Alcohol Assessment.  Attend the Victim Impact Panel meeting on 1/11/17 or serve 20 days Huber, consecutive, for non-attendance.

60 days with Day Report Center, consecutive to Huber sentence.

AS OF 1/30/2017: Court will permanently stay the 60 day DRC requirement.
To be performed within 3 years from today's date and to be monitored through WCS.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Bryan J Hoyt in court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses issues with Day Report Center.  Defendant makes statement.  State takes no position on DRC monitoring.  Court will permanently stay the 60 day DRC requirement.
Review hearing on January 30, 2017 at 08:30 am.
12/14/16 WCS Letter advising the Court that the Day Report Center is unable to supervise Defendant despite the court's order as a condition of his sentence.

Defendant Bryan J Hoyt in court, in custody, with attorney Cameron Weitzner.   Edward M Bremberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 3.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count #1 is dismissed outright.  Count #2 is dismissed and read into count #3.  Count #4 is dismissed by operation of law.   Attorney Weitzner requests the $500.00 bond previously forfeited by the Court be reinstated.  The Court denies the request. The defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT 3:

HUBER:  30 days, (apply 30 days credit) TIME SERVED.

DAY REPORT CENTER: 60 days, consecutive to Huber sentence. 

FINE: $1229.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation on 16CF1128);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00, to be paid as a condition of probation on 16CF1128 -  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $30.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to New Berlin Police Department. (to be paid as a condition of probation on 16CF1128).

TRANSCRIPT FEE:  $6.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to District Attorney. (to be paid as a condition of probation on 16CF1128).

D/L REVOCATION: 12 months;

IGNITION INTERLOCK: 12 months;

COMMUNITY SERVICE: Perform 50 Hours to be completed within 3 years, to be monitored by WCS.

Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel on:  1/11/17. Defendant to serve 20 days Huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend Victim Impact Panel.

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.

Defendant Bryan J Hoyt in court, in custody, with attorney Cameron Weitzner.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests speedy trial date.  Court sets.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for December 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on October 31, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Bryan J Hoyt in court, in custody, with attorney Cameron Weitzner.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for preliminary hearing.   City of New Berlin Police Officer Kevin Schultz sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Woller.  Identification stipulated.  Cross examination by Attorney Weitzner.  State rests.  Defense rests.  State moves for bind over.  Defense objects to bind over.   Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Attorney Weitzner renews his objection to bind over.  Court denies the objection.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 6, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Bryan J Hoyt in court, in custody, with attorney Cameron Weitzner.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Weitzner indicates they were going to proceed with the preliminary hearing today and based upon the state's witness not being in court today defense moves to dismiss.  Attorney Hulgaard indicates she believes notice was sent, however the officer did not receive the notice.  Court reviews the procedural history of the preliminary hearing time limits.  Attorney Weitzner presents arguments to the Court.  Attorney Hulgaard makes further statements to the Court.  Attorney Weitzner does not object to an adjournment at this point.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 30, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
